image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: Tom Silvagni, the son of Carlton Football Club great Stephen Silvagni, can now be identified as the man found guilty of rape in a trial, after a court lifted a restriction on publishing his name.

title.children: Tom Silvagni named as man from high-profile family convicted of rape

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Court of Appeal ruled to overturn the former Jetstar pilot's murder conviction and ordered a new trial.

title.children: The major takeaways from Greg Lynn's successful appeal

image.altText: Compilation of images showing the names of three universities.

props.synopsis: The final report into governance has called for state and Commonwealth legislation to refocus universities on teaching and research.

title.children: 'Dirty secret' of higher education revealed as senate inquiry calls on universities to change

image.altText: An apparent explosion in bushland sends flames shooting into the air

props.synopsis: Lives and homes are under threat in Perth's south-eastern suburbs and in the city's north-east as two fast-moving bushfires reach emergency warning level.

title.children: Emergency warnings issued for two bushfires burning in suburban Perth

image.altText: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping talk as they stand together.

props.synopsis: China's record breaking one trillion-dollar trade surplus shows Trump's tariffs have done little to tame Beijing's export juggernaut. In fact, they might have turbocharged it instead.

title.children: China's impressive trade surplus is making things hard for trading partners

image.altText: Paul Brereton speaks during a committee hearing.

props.synopsis: The anti-corruption watchdog chief personally drafted lines in a media release saying his recusal from defence cases was "unnecessary". His deputies have publicly disagreed.

title.children: Anti-corruption boss in open dispute with deputies over defence recusal

image.altText: A moving image of a parachute getting stuck on the tail wing of a plane.

props.synopsis: Australia’s transport safety regulator has released video footage of a skydiver cutting himself free from his parachute after it became snagged on a plane wing in mid-air.

title.children: Video shows moment skydiver cuts himself free from tangled parachute

image.altText: A blonde woman wearing a blue dress smiles in a venue.

props.synopsis: A high-profile British adult content creator will be banned from Bali for 10 years after police raided a "studio" on the island, in which 14 Australians were found.

title.children: Bonnie Blue to be banned from Bali after studio raid

image.altText: Profile of a woman.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for former federal environment minister Tanya Plibersek have defended the Commonwealth's acceptance of the Blue Banded Bee Dreaming to protect part of a gold mine site from development.

title.children: Court hears sensitive Dreaming story led to halt of billion-dollar mine

image.altText: Man in white shirt and black tie walking

props.synopsis: Gavin Morris, the former principal of Yipirinya School in Alice Springs, has received an 18-month suspended sentence for the aggravated assault of four students.

title.children: Ex-Alice Springs principal handed suspended sentence for assaulting students

image.altText: Olympic kayaker Alyce Wood smiles while holding her three month old daughter in her arms.

props.synopsis: The Australian Olympic Committee hopes to keep more athletes in sport by offering cash incentives for women who return after having children, and tens of thousands of dollars for retiring Olympians.

title.children: AOC offers cash incentives to keep Olympian mums in sport

image.altText: Rita, left, holds onto James, right, while both smile standing in their kitchen.

props.synopsis: Bespoke architectural builds on small budgets may seem like an impossible housing dream, but James and Rita managed to turn their vision into a reality — without breaking the bank.

title.children: Rita and James built an architecturally designed house for $320k. Here's how

image.altText: Generic photos of hire e-scooters on the street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: New research has revealed five people on average are ending up in Queensland hospitals from e-scooter injuries each day.

title.children: E-scooter injuries sending five people to Qld hospitals each day

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Anika Wells

props.synopsis: Pressed on whether his government should review the rules that allow politicians to fly their families around the country in business class, the prime minister says his focus is on the social media ban.

title.children: PM accused of shirking responsibility on Wells controversy

image.altText: Tourists in front of the Lincoln Memorial

props.synopsis: Australians travelling to the United States could soon face an unprecedented invasion of privacy, an international law expert has warned.

title.children: Privacy concerns over US proposing travellers reveal social media history

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the former NRL star seek to have a civil damages lawsuit against him dismissed, citing delays in the Supreme Court civil case.

title.children: Ex-NRL star Jarryd Hayne attempts to have civil case dismissed

image.altText: Four logs of rocky road on a cream coloured chopping board. Marshmallow, peanuts, pretzels and liquorice are visible

props.synopsis: This milk chocolate rocky road is easy to make. It creates 12 large slices, perfect for gifting or dessert if you're bringing a plate.

title.children: Easy rocky road that won't give you a sugar crash

image.altText: A group of zombies surround a car.

props.synopsis: As more businesses look to do their own advertising, audience complaints for social media ads are growing.

title.children: What the most complained-about ads of 2025 tell us

image.altText: A watch, ring, bracelet, police tape.

props.synopsis: Police allege the men travelled to Australia to rob a Canberra home, stealing distinctive, luxury items.

title.children: Four French men came to Canberra for a $10m heist, police say

image.altText: A man in a yellow puffer jacket, walking with his hands in his pockets and his head down.

props.synopsis: A judge says the former art shop worker had a "complete disconnect between perception and reality" as she jails him for rape.

title.children: Man jailed for 'orchestrated' rape of customer in shop where he worked

image.altText: Fire burns from the top of a gas well at night.

props.synopsis: A long-awaited scheme to force east coast energy giants to set aside gas for Australian use is being finalised in down-to-the-wire negotiations between half a dozen cabinet ministers grappling with concerns it may not lower prices as much as hoped.

title.children: Australia's gas shortage blamed on 'stupid decisions' under Howard

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference

props.synopsis: The prime minister wrote to states and territories this week, upping the Commonwealth's offer for public hospital funding.

title.children: Prime minister offers extra money to states for public hospitals

image.altText: Glynn and Amanda Lewis seated on a bench, with solemn expressions. A walker is next to Mandy.

props.synopsis: APRA says the fallout of HESTA's planned outage led to a "severe, prolonged disruption" that caused direct harm to some of its 1.1 million members, in a damning assessment of the fund.

title.children: 'A lesson for all funds': Super giant HESTA slammed by regulator

image.altText: A young man wearing a blue shirt and sunglasses outside the local court.

props.synopsis: The NT Court of Criminal Appeal has heard an appeal against the sentence for a 24-year-old driver who avoided a jail sentence after hitting two Aboriginal pedestrians with his vehicle, killing one, and then boasting about it over text.

title.children: 'Vile' and 'repugnant' texts sent by fatal hit-run driver at centre of appeal

image.altText: The front of a house in a street in Brookfield.

props.synopsis: A family who lived in a Melbourne home where police uncovered human remains while investigating the disappearance of a toddler say they are disturbed by the find.

title.children: Family who lived at home where human remains found 'trashed' house, sources say

image.altText: Close-up of Atlantic salmon.

props.synopsis: A salmon company gave Tasmanian authorities a week's notice before it planned to start using a new antibiotic in the state's waterways to combat a disease outbreak, sparking a strong rebuke from the industry regulator.

title.children: 'First I have heard': Regulator, salmon company at odds over antibiotics, emails show

image.altText: Maria Corina Machado in a black puffer jacket waving with her right hand in the air and smiling on a hotel balcony

props.synopsis: Venezuelan opposition leader and Nobel Peace Prize laureate Maria Corina Machado, who has been living in hiding in fear for her safety, appears in public for the first time in almost a year.

title.children: Peace Prize laureate emerges from hiding to greet cheering crowds

image.altText: Michael Jeffries with his head down getting into a car.

props.synopsis: Former Abercrombie & Fitch boss Michael Jeffries, who is part of a trio accused of luring men to drug-fuelled parties with the promise of modelling jobs, is facing federal sex trafficking charges.

title.children: Abercrombie & Fitch ex-CEO fit for sex trafficking trial, prison officials say

image.altText: Pete Hegseth, Richard Marles and John Healey stand at podiums in front of flags.

props.synopsis: The defence minister insists the AUKUS program is on track to provide Australia with nuclear-powered submarines in the next decade — despite the delays plaguing shipbuilding programs in both the US and the UK.

title.children: Hegseth praises Australia for 'stepping up' as Marles insists AUKUS is on track

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiling with blonde hair and wearing a striped shirt, date unknown.

props.synopsis: The 24-year-old is remembered for her generous spirit and love of animals. It took a protracted effort to bring her killer back to Australia and before a court, during which time he revealed little emotion.

title.children: Phone pings, a missing nurse and a $1m reward: The seven-year campaign to bring justice for Toyah

image.altText: a red icebreaker in distance beside ice

props.synopsis: The federal government has announced more than $200 million in additional funding over the next seven years for Antarctic science and logistics.

title.children: More research voyages and science jobs after Antarctic funding boost

image.altText: Illustration of hands using flint and pyrite to produce sparks.

props.synopsis: Archaeologists have uncovered the earliest-known evidence of deliberately lit campfires at a site in the UK dated to be 400,000 years old.

title.children: Neanderthals may have been fire starters 400,000 years ago

image.altText: A man with grey shoulder-length hair and beard gestures with his hand, a woman withe blonde hair stands behind him

props.synopsis: Authorities say the "best signs" in a "long time" have been observed in the latest round of monitoring of the state's algal bloom crisis.

title.children: 'Best signs we've seen': SA algal testing shows positive signs ahead of peak summer period

image.altText: Dylan Brown runs the ball during a match for New Zealand

props.synopsis: New Zealand's Dylan Brown seemed a certainty to claim the Golden Boot as rugby league's best international player for 2025 but the Kiwi five-eighth has missed out in a stunning twist.

title.children: Dylan Brown denied rugby league Golden Boot in shock upset

image.altText: A black and red oil tanker seen in a blue ocean, on a semi-blurred video screenshot with a green 'Unclassified' tag

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says the tanker is "the largest one ever seized".

title.children: US seizes oil tanker off coast of Venezuela, Trump says
